title: Rewrite AltFinder in native Swift/SwiftUI
description:
Rewrite the Electron/React/TypeScript file browser as a native macOS app using Swift and SwiftUI for better performance and native feel.

## Current Stack (to replace)
- Electron 39 + React 19 + TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS
- Vite build system
- electron-store for persistence

## Target Stack
- Swift 5.9+ / SwiftUI
- AppKit integration for Finder-like behavior
- UserDefaults/Core Data for persistence
- Native macOS file APIs

## Features to Preserve
- File browser with sortable columns (Name, Date Modified, Size, Kind)
- Breadcrumb navigation with back/forward history
- Pinned files/folders using .altfinder.json manifests
- File operations: copy, cut, paste, rename, delete to trash, create folder
- Context menu with quick actions
- Search/filter in current directory
- Hidden files toggle
- Dark/light mode support
- Window state persistence
- Keyboard shortcuts (Cmd+C, Cmd+X, Cmd+V, Cmd+Shift+N, etc.)
- Security-scoped bookmarks for tracking pinned files across renames

## Goals
- Native performance (no Chromium overhead)
- Native look and feel
- Smaller app size
- Better system integration
close_reason: Implemented native Swift/SwiftUI version in AltFinderSwift/ directory. App builds and runs successfully with all major features: file browsing, navigation, pinned files, file operations, context menu, search, and keyboard shortcuts.
